titles.title: A resolution congratulating the Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania on the 100th anniversary of their declarations of independence.
A resolution congratulating the Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania on the 100th anniversary of their declarations of independence.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Corker with an amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 356.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary:
Congratulates the people of Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania on the 100th anniversary of their declarations of independence.
Commends: (1) the people and governments of such countries for their successful reforms and economic growth since 1991, and (2) such countries for their commitment to democracy and respect for human rights and for their leadership in furthering those values abroad.
Applauds the partnership the United States enjoys with the Baltic states in many spheres, including the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
Recognizes the determination of such governments to strengthen transatlantic security.
Reiterates the continued support of the Senate for the European Deterrence Initiative.
